website_summaries.verdict: The Asics Gel Flux 3 is a road running shoe that offers a combination of flexibility and responsive cushioning. The durability and the technology used made this shoe best for short and long distance runs as well as for daily training.
pros: The Gel Flux 3 has breathable upper mesh and overlays that promote a snug and secure fit based on the comments of several runners
Some runners applauded the DuraSponge Outsole of the shoe that offers flexibility and responsive cushioning
The silicone-based gel cushioning promotes efficient shock absorption
Others were impressed by the durable construction of the Asics Gel Flux 3
Comfort is amazing, according to a handful of runners
The transition is decent while responsive cushioning is noticeable based on some reviews
Runners took note of the shoe's good arch support
cons: The shoe is too narrow for some runners
Some felt that there is less cushioning on the sole
A few mentioned that the shoe feels heavy while running

customer_reviews.title: Money wasted!!
customer_reviews.text: After running approximately 500 miles in my Gel Flux2 I bought these as I couldn't find another pair of the Flux2. What a mistake!!! Smaller toebox, less cushion and ultimately just a different shoe. I had a half marathon to race and had to use an old pair of Cumulus 17 as even after trying to break these in I had to give up.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Nice cushioning but too narrow in the toes
customer_reviews.text: The fit in the toe for a 12 D was way too tight. I wore them for a very short run and short walk (less than 5 mi total) and ended up with a huge blister on my toe. I always wear a 11.5 or 12 D (never had to buy wide shoes before), so I was surprised. However, the cushioning in the bed of the shoe was very comfortable. I really wanted to like these shoes, but they were just too uncomfortable because of the tightness on the toes. I had to return the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: MCwvu

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and supportive. Even for a Spartan Super race!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a change for my husband who only wears Nike. He loves them! He chooses these over his Nikes almost every day. He also chose these to run in when he did the Spartan Super race and said he's glad he did. He said they were really comfortable and supportive and he had no pain afterwards. Needless to say they were ruined and this is his second pair that he specifically asked for. We did have to go up a half size for his comfort, but that might just be personal preference. Highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: NSCali

customer_reviews.title: Not up to Asics' usual standards
customer_reviews.text: Not at all pleased with this shoe as I have been with other Asics products (Gel GT2000 2, Gel Kayano) This one feels narrow in the toe box, and I had the balls of both feet throbbing after wearing them a short while. I'm hoping they just need to get broken in? I never had to do that with the other Asics shoes, but they aso don't seem to be the "top-shelf" of Asics' stable. They may get relegated to lawn-mowing duty; I won't be looking to buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: E. Iverson

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly for big boy who wears Big boy 7+
customer_reviews.text: My son is only 9 yrs old, but he is tall amd has big feet. He used to wear Big Boy size 7 from either ASICS or NIKE. However the Big boy 7 becomes too tight. I ordered Men 7.5 before. It was way too big and wide. So I ordered Men size 7 this time. It works perfectly. My family has little wide feet, so ASICS works better than NIKE.
customer_reviews.author: AthletsMom

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes ever, will buy again and again
customer_reviews.text: Used these shoes for longer than remember Very lightweight Longevity really good and very less wear and tear over the time Really recommend these shoes Cant list any cons as there are none.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it's just horrible. These things have really hurt my left heel
customer_reviews.text: They KILL your heel! I think other people here have mentioned this but I'll be one more: I don't know what they did but it HURTS SO MUCH, it's just horrible. These things have really hurt my left heel, I think it's the hard part they've raised up further in the back? I don't know, I just know these shoes are unwearable and it's past the return period so I'm screwed, really pissed off, and won't be buying Asics again. I'll be replacing these with Nikes or Brooks or someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Bought these sneakers for my 9 year old the end of March. It is now May 4th and both shoes are falli apart! Very disappointed that I spent $60+ on sneakers he wears 2x a week for PE and they look like this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I have RA and I am usually stuck with ugly man crocks because it is all I can tolerate. I have all sorts of shoes in my closet my feet hate. One of my sonss and I prefer similar shoe styles and he promised me these would work for me. For the first time in 3 years I can wear real shoes most of my work day. Bonus, it comes in Georgia Tech colors, where my boys are currently sophomores.
customer_reviews.author: jeanne-hope

customer_reviews.title: Walking on a cloud
customer_reviews.text: Once again Asics delivers an excellent product. This 3rd generation is as comfortable as the first or second generation of this shoe line. Superb fit and finish. There is minimal break-in period, and it provides excellent ventilation. After two weeks of daily extensive use (14+) hours of wear, my feet still feel fresh. No pain or soreness. The shoe has held its shape and the foam has not collapsed any. The sole has remained intact. Highly recommended for basic runners or walkers, or those that need to be in their feet for extended periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Plum

customer_reviews.title: I'm switching to ASICS
customer_reviews.text: I did not think they were going to fit. Since I'm always getting running shoes that fit too small or tight on my right foot. However, this one was the exception. Fit just right 9's 4W..... Now I know that's my size at least with the brand ASICS.... they fit better than any New Balance shoes specially lately, every version of New Balance creates another fitting issue. So, I think I'll start buying ASICS.
customer_reviews.author: NELSON PAYNE

customer_reviews.title: These were as expected i always recommend ASICS products when it comes to lasting quality
customer_reviews.text: These were as expected i always recommend ASICS products when it comes to lasting quality. While i was currently wearing a 10 in this case the line does run large so a 9.5 would have been ideal. While i am no longer a runner these shoes have been great for general everyday use and around the house some light activity. i would absolutely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ASICS are great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I'm a tad biased - I wrestled in ASICS in high school and am brand-loyal. But light shoes, sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Donald T. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: ... on they were a little stiff and it felt like the instep pad was set a little too far ...
customer_reviews.text: When I first tried them on they were a little stiff and it felt like the instep pad was set a little too far back toward the heal. However, after wearing them a couple of times they seemed to move into place and the shoes now fit fine. I have some neuropathy and the firm but gel fit helps me walk with better balance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: glad I didn't go any smaller
customer_reviews.text: Red/white/black has no white other than in the sole, so picture is incorrect, it's more silver/grey. Arch support is non-existent in 12.5. I'm an 11.5 but grabbed these and they fit ok, glad I didn't go any smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for more than just running. Comfort Plus!
customer_reviews.text: I have sugar diabietic problems especially with my feet. I have purchased other shoes that were supposed to be for people with sugar. I can truthly say that my feet hurt mostly on the balls of my feet and toes. These ASIC running shoes are the very most comfortable shoes I have had since my troubles began. they are even better than the diabetic shoes that I have received that were especiall taken from a mold of each foot. I am sure I want ot get another pair just the same as soon as I can. For now I am very happy with these shoes. Good choice and good fair price. Sincerely, Charles Black
customer_reviews.author: Charles D. Black

customer_reviews.title: ... all the time - says they are the most comfortable sneakers he has ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my father and he wears them all the time - says they are the most comfortable sneakers he has ever owned! I have a women's pair for myself and I agree! Love ASICS, love this shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie B.

customer_reviews.title: A decent pair of shoes, no complaints
customer_reviews.text: one of the better sets of shoes I've purchased. I would wish for a little better arch support, but my feet have unusually high arches and these shoes were not advertised as having superb support as a feature.
customer_reviews.author: crazycrawfish

customer_reviews.title: Very good Shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these i have had, Very good shoes
customer_reviews.author: JOHN V

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Plus Plus
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Asics and i am even happier. Cant recommend them enough! I have plantar fascitis in both heels and need good shoes in which i can do brisk walks/jogs for some exercise 5-6 hours a week. These shoes are just perfect for that. Never experienced any pains since i started using them. In terms of size, i usually wear size 9, but i went half size up with these and they are wider and i can fit in them much better. The price at which you get these awesome shoes makes is an amazin deal. Dont think about these, just buy them and you will not go back to any other running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: CS Kashyap

customer_reviews.title: ... my second pair of Asics running shoes and they're great. Super comfortable and cushioned
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Asics running shoes and they're great. Super comfortable and cushioned. I find it hard wearing other sneakers now after getting used to the.
customer_reviews.author: Damiel Luis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent running shoes at this price point. Good to excellent support, roomy toe box, firm fit in the heel, and a joy to train in. Like most ASICS, they use vinyl stock for the stitching backing and design.
customer_reviews.author: mtborah

customer_reviews.title: great shoes
customer_reviews.text: great shoe, wish they made these again, the flux 4 isnt quite the same, these were perfect. lasted a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J

customer_reviews.title: Top choice
customer_reviews.text: I've had previous models from ASICS, it was time for an upgrade and decided to get theses, not disappointed at all 👍

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic shoes, even good for the long runs
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoes, even good for the long runs. I'm a bigger dude and they wear out faster, but all shoes do when you're 6'3 and built more for football than long distance running. These were my second pair.

customer_reviews.text: I really like the shoe its comfortable and fits well. Its hard to give a five on shoes because it really needs to at least last a couple months.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, no if's or blisters
customer_reviews.text: I've had the flux 3 for my previous 2 running shoes. It's a great shoe, lasts several months (250-300 miles) is comfy, great shock absorption and priced right. In a few months I'll be buying again!

customer_reviews.title: These ones are pretty good, and reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: I can't answer to arch support as I use orthotics. Also, I answered that these fit 'as expected' because I only ever buy Asics running shoes and know my size in them. These ones are pretty good, and reasonably priced. Like them so far.
customer_reviews.author: rickjames8

customer_reviews.title: nice asics - buy wide or wider medium may be too narrow

customer_reviews.author: NP.

customer_reviews.title: These are great shoes. They are comfortable as soon as I ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. They are comfortable as soon as I put them on. The look is sharp too. Great support. Love them. Only sad thing was right after I purchased them, the price was lowered by $21.

customer_reviews.title: I put these on and instantly feels like my favorite pair
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a previous pair of the same kind, but in different colors. I put these on and instantly feels like my favorite pair.

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have been a long time buyer of ASICS, and they are starting to become hit and miss, as far as arch support goes. These are very comfortable shoes, but could use a little more arch support.

customer_reviews.title: Good two years

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and always comfortable

customer_reviews.title: cushy and supportive for neutral runners
customer_reviews.text: good bang for buck, cushioned running shoe, for the novice/ recreational/ shorter distance runner. 4E width is very wide. Length seems just a bit short of true to size, so I'd say if you aren't sure of your size, order a half size up in length.

customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for my husband. He has had them several months, and they are holding up great. They fit great, and look great on!

customer_reviews.text: Asics are a fantastic brand, however these were not my favorite pair of shoes from them. Still constructed very nice just a bit too hard.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and light
customer_reviews.text: No tab on back of shoe to help pull it on. Right shoe slips a little when walking. Comfortable and light; a pleasure to take the dog for a walk.

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend these for a running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend these for a running shoe. The arch support is not good at all, it will make your arch hurt, and if you wear them for long drives they make your feet go numb. I am an asics fan but these are not up to par with the higher nimbus or cumulus models.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Like the quality
customer_reviews.text: Like the quality, I think they improved the point part. Sadly the fit is a litte larger than other asics I have bought this size, otherwise because of the build these would be my prefered ones.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Slightly small in toe box...figure they will dtrach over time. The colors were htrat!

customer_reviews.title: everyday of walking and jogging and have found these shoes to be durable and comfortable. I chose them specifically because they
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of GEL Flux 3's. I average about 5 miles per day, everyday of walking and jogging and have found these shoes to be durable and comfortable. I chose them specifically because they are recommended for supination (outward roll of the foot). The soles are sturdy, durable and keep my feet from rolling out so much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... been buying Asics GT2000 for a long time and liked them. I find that I tend to have ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Asics GT2000 for a long time and liked them. I find that I tend to have a weak ankle that rolls in, these should help with that. And they are less expensive.

customer_reviews.title: Size issue
customer_reviews.text: Weirdest thing. I love asics and have worn them for years. This pair came and fit too tight on left foot but ok on right. Thought maybe they would stretch and be comfortable but I have given up. Went back to my old asics.

customer_reviews.text: ASICS area great shoes.. saw these in the store and they didn't have my size so I came here and bought them.. love um!

customer_reviews.text: I bought a half-size larger than 'regular' shoes, and in the wide width. Excellent fit, excellent cushioning.

customer_reviews.title: I usually take a 2E running shoes and find the ...
customer_reviews.text: I usually take a 2E running shoes and find the normal shoe size (D), that I bought too wide. I would take a half size smaller and maybe a smaller fit. I am surprised by this. I assumed it would be snug. Nope

customer_reviews.title: Looks great with any outfit!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! Fit perfectly! Looks great with any outfit!

customer_reviews.title: Lacks cushioning
customer_reviews.text: Received shoes and they fit about right. They were returned as they lacked cushioning and were way too stiff/hard. I purchased as I felt at the time it was a great price. I have been a loyal wearer of Asics shoes for over 6 years. This was a bit of a downgrade for me from previous Asics shoe purchases. I guess you get what you pay for.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They are so comfortable on my feet. I can't stop wiggling my toes when I have them on.

customer_reviews.title: ... and have bought ASICS in the past and been happy with them
customer_reviews.text: Needed new running shoes and have bought ASICS in the past and been happy with them. Just as happy with these!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box went on a 5 mile walk ,no complaints at all.

customer_reviews.title: Great supportive, light shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic shoes. My last pair of running shoes were ASICS GEL Kayano 23, which had more support, cushioning, and weight. Compared to these which have as much support, but a little less cushioning and less weight, which is what I was looking for. I also use insoles that were fitted at Roadrunner, with which I replaced the original insoles. These shoes have the support I need with a more solid-feeling sole compared to the Kayano.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Best brand of running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Asics. No need to say anything more. The brand continuously exceeds all others. The only running shoe in wide width worth buying.

customer_reviews.text: It was a gift but I was thanked greatly. They loved them. Asics are the best.

customer_reviews.text: I buy a few of these each year, in different colors. It's my favorite sneaker for walking, running, working...

customer_reviews.author: CPHas82349

customer_reviews.text: Loved these shoes. I have a wide foot, and running shoes are often too narrow for me. These fit great, very light and breathable. Will definitely buy them again, great value.

customer_reviews.text: always enjoy Asics. Nike just doesn't feel as comfortable on my feet.

customer_reviews.text: I have supine feet and my knees hurt. This shoes, along with knee excersice, are the best treatment I could find. Recommended!

customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit well, though not perfect. What shoe is actually perfect? I recommend this brand for the occasional runner/walker.

customer_reviews.title: Asics shoe. not bad, a little big
customer_reviews.text: Shoe was alright. I ordered the same size I always do when i got these shoes. Mens 11. But when I compared them to my old pair of Asics i was replacing, this style was .5" longer. Shoe still fits ok but Id advise anyone to try them on at a store first.

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit, comfortable, and light in weight
customer_reviews.text: I wore New Balance M587 and it's predecessor since 1993. I find something I like and I do not want to change. That shoe has been discontinued. Finding a shoe that fits and is comfortable is a daunting task. I went to a shoe finder program on another website. It suggested this shoe. I purchased it on Amazon because it was lower in price. I like this shoe better than the New Balance M587. I am not a runner but I stand a lot in my part time job and I walk, so I cannot tell you how well it performs while running in them.

customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good wide shoe. Possibly could have gotten 5 stars if they didn’t squeak.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

product_meta.title: ASICS Mens Gel-Flux 3-M Gel-Flux 3
product_meta.description: Boasting Rearfoot and Forefoot GEL® Cushioning and a bouncy SpEVA® midsole, the GEL-Flux™ 3 model is athletic, cushioned, and even a little bit peppy. The upper is built with supportive synthetic overlays and a breathable mesh for optimal fit and comfort, while the Guidance Line® Technology and Guidance Trusstic System® Technology keep the ride smooth and efficient.
feature_bullets: Rearfoot and Forefoot GEL Cushioning Systems: Attenuates shock during impact and toe-off phases, and allows movement on multiple planes as the foot transitions through the gait cycle.
SpEVA Midsole: Material Improves bounce-back characteristics and decreases midsole breakdown.
Guidance Line:  Vertical flex groove decouples the tooling along the line of progression for enhanced gait efficiency.
Guidance Trusstic: This Trusstic System:  integrates Guidance Line construction for enhanced gait efficiency while providing midfoot structural integrity.
DuraSponge:  Outsole A blown AHAR rubber compound for enhanced cushioning and durability in the forefoot.
